item.title: Senior Expert in Private Sector Development (TL)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Mid-term Evaluation for Assistance to Agriculture in the West Bank (AAWB) and Private Sector Reconstruction Gaza Agriculture (PSRG-A) Programmes

The AAWB programme entered into full scale implementation aiming to serve about 400 final beneficiaries as well as the PSRG-A programme may serve about 400 final beneficiaries too. In total the estimated number of final beneficiaries is estimated at 800.

DESCRIPTION OF THE EVALUATION ASSIGNMENT

  • nd PSRG-A Programmes under three decisions
  • Geographic scope West Bank and Gaza Strip
  • Period to be evaluated The entire period

Project duration: 120 days

Expert in Private Sector Development – Team leader

  • Education at least a Master’s Degree in Business Administration, Economics or Agricultural Engineering or
  • other cognate discipline; OR equivalent professional experience of 6 years (above the general professional experience duration fixed below) in an area of private sector development related to microfinance.

General professional experience:

  • At least 12 years professional experience in the management and/or evaluation of projects in the fields of development aid.

Specific professional experience

  • At least 5 years' experience in managing and/or delivering micro-finance similar projects/programmes;
  • At least 2 years' experience of evaluation similar programmes;
  • Knowledge of the EC’s implementing rules and guidelines (including DEVCO evaluation approach and methodology: https://ec.europa.eu/europeaid/evaluation/methodology_en);
  • Previous experience leading evaluation teams;
  • Excellent coordination and team management skills;
  • Proven experience of working in a development policy environment in fragile or conflict affected regions.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to nicte_garcia-soria@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Category I Expert – Water Resources Engineer
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Identification and Formulation Mission for the Revival of Balochistan Water Resources Programme

The global objective of this assignment is to assist the EU Delegation in identifying and formulating a realistic demand driven programme for the Revival of Balochistan Water Resources Programme.

The specific objective is to assist the EU Delegation in drafting an Identification Fiche, Action Document for the Revival of Baluchistan Water Resources Programme of €65 million, (€50 million from the EU and €15 million from blending facility) to be approved by the headquarters within the year 2018.

Category I Expert – Water Resources Engineer

Qualifications and Skills

  • A University degree in Civil, Agriculture or Water Resources Engineering or a relevant, directly related discipline.
  • Post graduate studies and/or trainings in the areas related to water sector development will be considered an advantage.
  • Full working knowledge of English and excellent report writing.

General Professional Experience

  • At least 12 years of professional experience is required in water sector development programme, on-farm water management and high irrigation efficiency system, water conservation and rain water harvesting, canal water including control of surface water, mini dams and recharge of ground water techniques.
  • At least 8 years of professional experience is required in the developing countries on water sector programmes.
  • At least 5 years of experience as a team member for conducting identification and formulation of water sector projects with the government authorities, coordinating with donors and civil society organizations.
  • Preferably required professional experience in Pakistan or South Asian countries, Afghanistan, Bangladesh, Bhutan, India, Maldives and Sri Lanka.
  • Proven capacity to adapt to hard working conditions.

Specific Professional Experience

  • Experience of undertaking a minimum of 8 identification and/or formulation of programmes in support of water sector and/or agriculture development in at least 3 different countries. Such experience will be considered more relevant if referring to a minimum of 3 EU-funded interventions and if specifically applied to water conservation, water saving techniques for irrigated agriculture and recharge of ground water and/or to South Asia or water stressed countries.
  • Experience in policy setting/drafting preferably in a field related to water related programmes or poverty reduction.
  • Experience of working with government planning and development, finance and other relevant line departments is preferred.
  • Good understanding of EU external cooperation policies and instruments and in particular of the above mentioned relevant sectors EU policy and procedure is necessary.
  • Sound knowledge of Project Cycle Management (PCM).
  • Experience in identifying and formulation missions of EU.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to aurelie_durand@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Water Sector Development Expert (Economist - Team Leader)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Identification and Formulation Mission for the Revival of Balochistan Water Resources Programme

The global objective of this assignment is to assist the EU Delegation in identifying and formulating a realistic demand driven programme for the Revival of Balochistan Water Resources Programme.

The specific objective is to assist the EU Delegation in drafting an Identification Fiche, Action Document for the Revival of Baluchistan Water Resources Programme of €65 million, (€50 million from the EU and €15 million from blending facility) to be approved by the headquarters within the year 2018.

Key Expert I – Water Sector Development Expert (Economist - Team Leader)

The Team Leader will be responsible for overall assignment, coordination with the relevant partners along with the other team member. The Team Leader will be the focal point of contact for the EU Delegation. The Team Leader will also present the Aide Memoire and lead the meetings with the line agencies and relevant organizations involved in the water sector of Baluchistan.

Qualifications and Skills

  • A University degree in Development Economics, Public Policy and Administration, Public Finance Management, Development Studies, or a relevant, directly related discipline.
  • Post graduate studies and/or specific training in related areas will be considered an advantage.
  • Full working knowledge of English and excellent report writing.

General Professional Experience

  • At least 12 years of professional experience is required in one or more of the following fields: water development programme, water resource management, agriculture and on-farm water management, planning and administration.
  • At least 8 years of professional experience is required in the developing countries.
  • At least 5 years of experience as Team Leader for conducting identification and formulation of water sector projects with the government authorities, coordinating with donors and civil society organizations.
  • Preferably required professional experience in Pakistan or South Asian countries, Afghanistan, Bangladesh, Bhutan, India, Maldives and Sri Lanka.
  • Proven capacity to adapt to hard working conditions.
  • Proven 5 years managerial skills as far as orienting a mission, analyzing complex situations, relating professionally and efficiently with multiple stakeholders over a limited duration of time, drafting possible and feasible scenarios.

Specific Professional Experience

  • Experience of undertaking a minimum of 8 identification and/or formulation of programmes in support of water sector and/or agriculture development in at least 3 different countries. Such experience will be considered more relevant if referring to a minimum of 3 EU-funded interventions and if specifically applied to water and agriculture and/or to South Asia or water stressed countries.
  • Experience in policy setting/drafting preferably in a field related to water or poverty reduction.
  • Experience of working with government planning and development, finance and other relevant line departments is preferred.
  • Good understanding of EU external cooperation policies and instruments and in particular of the above mentioned relevant sectors EU policy and procedure is necessary.
  • Sound knowledge of Project Cycle Management (PCM).
  • Experience in identification and formulation missions of EU

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to aurelie_durand@dai.com

item.title: Pool of Experts, IDDF Advisory Services
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
IDDF Advisory Services

The overall objective of the project is to further develop and apply the Integrated Decentralisation Diagnostic Framework (IDDF).

Project duration: December 2017 to October 2018

A Pool of Experts with the same profile will be required in the application of the IDDF in 6 selected countries (to be confirmed).

  • professional experience in development cooperation / international relations;
  • experience in the design and implementation of programs aiming at supporting decentralisation reforms, local development and Local Governance in developing countries;
  • experience as a coordinator of teams implementing support programs in the field of decentralisation, local Governance and/or Local development in partner countries;
  • Experience in designing and conducting studies and analysis in fields related the assignment, and in drafting related terms of references;
  • Experience in mainstreaming of local authorities in overall EU development cooperation;
  • Sound knowledge of EC aid modalities (budget support, project approach) as well as aid delivery mechanism;
  • professional experience in organising and delivering seminars and workshop related to decentralisation reforms, local and territorial development, territorial approaches and the mainstreaming of LAs in EU supported programs and projects with excellent facilitation and presentation skills;
  • Excellent drafting and oral presentation skills;
  • Previous experience in the context of the Thematic Programme CSO-LA and/or its predecessor will be an asset;
  • Fluent in English, French and Spanish. Portuguese will be an asset

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to Gabriela_Georgieva@dai.com

item.title: Security Expert (CAT I)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Study to identify areas of beneficial cooperation between CARIFORM and Latin America in the area of Crime and Security

To undertake a study to identify possible areas of beneficial cooperation between CARIFORUM and Latin America, including concrete entry points for Caribbean participation in existing EU continental cooperation programmes with Latin America in the area of Crime and Security.

KE1: Security Expert (CAT I)

Qualifications and skills

  • Post graduate qualifications (at least a Master’s degree) or equivalent (or, in its absence,equivalent professional experience – see also below) in Security Studies, Law, Political Sciences, or related fields;
  • Solid analytical skills, particularly the ability to conduct research and prepare appropriate findings and conclusions;
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills (both oral and written), including demonstrated tact in intercultural communication;
  • Ability to build trust across cultural lines;
  • Excellent report writing skills;
  • Strong planning and organisation skills;
  • Fluency/mastery in oral and written English and at least effective operational proficiency in Spanish;
  • Computer literacy.

Professional experience

  • At least twelve (12) years’ experience in the security sector, but in the absence of postgraduate qualifications at least four more years of relevant professional experience;
  • Experience at a senior or advisory level in either Government, a relevant international or regional organisation would be an asset;
  • Experience in the security sector reform in an international environment;
  • Direct experience in statistical analysis and research in a developing country context;
  • Up-to-date and comprehensive knowledge and experience of EU development policies and instruments;
  • Experience of EU practices in development programmes related to the sector would be an asset;
  • Previous consulting and relevant experience of working in Latin America and/or the Caribbean.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to Gabriela_georgieva@dai.com

item.title: International Relations Specialist or Economic Development Specialist
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Consultancy to develop a framework for an effective platform for structured and continuous FCORs/OCTS/CARIFORUM dialogue at the political and technical level

The global objective of the Programme is to deepen and strengthen cooperation and contribute to the sustainable social and economic development of the Wider Caribbean Region.

The specific objective is to design a framework for structured and continuous dialogue to strengthen political, economic and technical cooperation between the Caribbean Forum of the African, Caribbean and Pacific States (CARIFORUM), the FCORs and OCTs.

Key expert 2: International Relations Specialist or Economic Development Specialist

Qualifications and Skills

  • At least a Master’s Degree in International Relations, International Development Policy, Development Economics, Business/Public Administration or related discipline;
  • OR in its absence not less than three (3) years' relevant experience in addition to the 12 years professional experience required below
  • Knowledge of the economic, social and political development realities in the CARIFORUM/FCOR/OCT context would be an asset;
  • Fluency in English (written and spoken) and good articulation in French is required. Articulation in Spanish and/or Dutch would be a further asset but is not necessary.

General Experience

  • A minimum of 12-years relevant development cooperation and regional integration experience;
  • Demonstrated experience in formulation, organization, planning, and/or implementation of regional economic and political cooperation and collaboration policy and related activities, including knowledge and experience of related EDF procedures and processes;
  • Demonstrated professional experience in the fostering of inter-agency and inter-governmental relations, including the formulation of policy for the promotion of regional cooperation, collaboration and integration, at both the technical and political levels;

Specific Professional Experience

  • Demonstrated experience in relevant institutional strengthening and reform processes; such experience in a general Caribbean regional cooperation context would be a plus.
  • Demonstrated experience as a Team Leader in relevant regional cooperation processes;
  • Knowledge of the Caribbean Regional Integration processes and the EU/CARIFORUM EPA process will be an advantage.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to aurelie_durand@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Expert in Non-Trade Barriers (NTB), Technical Barriers to Trade (TBT) and Sanitary and Phyto-Sanitary Measures
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Support to the Ministry of Industrialisation, Trade & SME Development and the Namibia Trade Forum

The team will work to enhance trade and business opportunities in Namibia that contribute to sustainable and inclusive economic development, in the framework of the ACP-EU Partnership Agreement and the EU-SADC Economic Partnership Agreement (EPA). They will have to assist the Ministry of Industrialisation, Trade & SME Development through the Namibia Trade Forum in liaison with other stakeholders – such as the ministries of Agriculture, Fisheries, the Statistic Agency and the Namibia Standard Institute, as well as other relevant Government and non-governmental Agencies and institutions – in defining an EPA Implementation Plan for Namibia. Additionally, they will also have to define a trade and business agenda and an all-inclusive institutional set-up that aims at improving the ease of doing business and incentivising investments for local, regional and European companies.

KE2 – Non-trade Barriers (NTB), Technical Barriers to Trade (TBT) and Snaitary and Phyto-Sanitary Measures (SPS) Expert

Qualification

  • A Master’s degree or equivalent qualification in economics, business administration, trade or another relevant field is required, or in its absence, a relevant Bachelor’s degree or equivalent plus an additional 2 years of professional experience over and above what is requested below (second bullet);

Experience

  • At least 6 years’ experience in developing countries1 in providing advice on trade related issues, in particular on non-trade barriers, technical barriers to trade and sanitary and phyto-sanitary measures.
  • Previous experience in undertaking a capacity needs assessment or institutional assessment in NTB, TBT and SPS issues, as well as the delivery of capacity building is preferred.
  • Previous experience of EPA / regional trade agreements implementation is preferred.
  • Excellent communication and writing skills in English is required

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to gabriela_georgieva@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Senior Expert in Legal Harmonisation
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Technical Assistance for Development of Consumer Protection Policy

The global objective of the project is to set-up environment for efficient and effective protection of consumer rights. The team will be expected to complete the following:

  • Achieve further harmonisation of the national legislation in the consumer protection area with the relevant EU acquis;
  • Develop a Consumer Protection Strategy (covering 5-year period);
  • Strengthen the institutional capacity of the various stakeholders responsible for developing and implementing laws and policies in the area of consumer protection;

Expert 2/Category 1: Senior Expert in Legal Harmonisation

Qualifications and Skills:

  • Education at least master’s degree in law, or in its absence, general professional experience of at least 5 years above the required general professional experience.
  • Excellent command of English both- oral and writing; and
  • Excellent computer literacy.

General professional Experience:

  • Minimum 12 years of general professional experience in the area of EU internal market.

Specific Professional Experience:

  • At least three (3) years of experience as legal expert in consumer protection field, such as: acting as a legal practitioner/lawyer on subjects in the area, providing counselling for legal gap analyses, law assessment, legal harmonisation with EU acquis, and similar;
  • Experience in the area of consumer protection in EU member countries or candidate countries shall be considered an asset.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to gabriela_georgieva@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Expertise 2: junior, de catégorie II, en cartographie et systèmes d’information géographique

item.description:
Experience and Qualifications required:

Description of Project:

Renforcement des capacités techniques et juridiques en matière de protection des ressources en eau en soutenant le processus de rapprochement vers les exigences de l’Acquis et des bonnes pratiques européennes.

Qualifications et competences:

  • Diplôme universitaire supérieur, de niveau Master (Bac +5), en cartographie ou systèmes d’information géographiques, ou diplôme équivalent et pertinent par rapport aux objectifs du contrat ;
    Une expérience professionnelle de 6 ans en cartographie ou systèmes d’information géographiques appliquée et modélisation numérique en plus de celle indiquée comme expérience professionnelle générale, pourra compenser l’absence de Master ; Expérience professionnelle générale : Critère minimum : 6 ans d’expérience minimum en cartographie ou systèmes d’information géographiques ;

Expérience professionnelle spécifique :

    Atout : expérience professionnelle d’au moins 1 an en tant que formateur en projets de cartographie ou de systèmes d’information géographiques.

Connaissance linguistique :

  • Bonne maîtrise de la langue française parlée et écrite.

item.title: Legal Expert (Cat. II)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Policy Advice to the Government of Kyrgyzstan

Global objective:

To assist the Government of the Kyrgyz Republic and other actors to improve their capacity to implement strategic and economic reforms towards efficient and equitable delivery of high quality, cost effective services.

Specific objectives:

The specific objectives of this assignment are to provide advisory services and to strengthen capacity of the Government staff to (i) take an active role in the policy dialogue between the EU and KR and demonstrate commitment to the fundamental values of human rights, democracy and the rule of law; (ii) take an active role in EU aid programming and implementation as well as cooperation.

Legal Expert (Cat. II)

Qualifications and skills:

  • Master’s degree in the field of law or minimum of 7 years of professional experience in legal area.

General professional experience

  • At least 6 years of relevant professional experience in the sectors related to Lot 7

Specific professional experience

  • At least 6 years of working experience in legal issues in the Kyrgyz Republic;
  • At least 2 years of working experience in the legal analysis and/or development of the Country Strategy and/or the Sector Development Strategy;
  • Working experience in projects funded by the Development Partners;
  • Working experience in at least two EU-funded projects; • Knowledge of the EU budget support and EU programming exercise will be a strong asset

Language skills

  • Fluency in Russian
  • Working level of English.
  • Knowledge of Kyrgyz language is a strong asset

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to anju_english@dai.com

item.title: Team Leader - Adviser (Cat. I)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Policy Advice to the Government of Kyrgyzstan

Global objective:

To assist the Government of the Kyrgyz Republic and other actors to improve their capacity to implement strategic and economic reforms towards efficient and equitable delivery of high quality, cost effective services.

Specific objectives:

The specific objectives of this assignment are to provide advisory services and to strengthen capacity of the Government staff to (i) take an active role in the policy dialogue between the EU and KR and demonstrate commitment to the fundamental values of human rights, democracy and the rule of law; (ii) take an active role in EU aid programming and implementation as well as cooperation.

Team Leader - Adviser (Cat. I)

Qualifications and skills:

  • Master’s degree in the field of economics or law or minimum of 14 years of professional experience in economic or legal area.
  • At least 2 years professional experience at team leader’s level.

General professional experience:

  • At least 12 years' experience in the sectors related to Lot 7

Specific professional experience:

  • At least 3 years of working experience in the EU legal framework, incl. EU trade regulations;
  • Working experience in GSP+ issues;
  • At least 3 years of working experience in post-Soviet countries;
  • Working experience in Kyrgyzstan will be a strong asset;
  • Working experience in at least two EU-funded projects;
  • Knowledge of the Partnership and Cooperation Agreements between the EU and partner countries will be a strong asset

Language skills

  • Fluency in English
  • Fluency in Russian

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to anju_english@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Expert dans le Domaine de la Filière d’Elevage (Catégorie III)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Lecons Tirees de Deux Projets du Secteur De L'Elevage et Propositions pour Poursuivre L'appui dans Le 11eme FED

L'objectif général de la prestation est de renforcer l’efficacité et augmenter l'impact de l'appui de l’Union Européenne dans la filière d’élevage (cycle court) en République de la Guinée-Bissau.

Les objectifs spécifiques de la prestation sont :

  • tirer les leçons des deux projets mis en oeuvre par IMVF et par Mani Tese;
  • formuler des propositions pour renforcer la filière d'élevage et les stratégies d'appui à suivre dans le cadre du 11ème FED.

Expert dans le Domaine de la Filière d’Elevage (Catégorie III)

  • Diplôme universitaire ou un master de niveau universitaire ou équivalent en sciences sociales, agronomie, économie agricole ou équivalent.
  • Expérience professionnelle en matière de coopération au développement en général et dans le domaine spécifique de la filière d’élevage, en particulier.
  • Expérience professionnelle internationale, en particulier dans les pays de l'Afrique de l'Ouest et/ou dans des Pays Moins Avancés (PMA); expérience en Guinée-Bissau serait un plus.
  • Expérience avérée en matière d'évaluation et maîtrise démontrée des principes et des méthodes de travail de la gestion du cycle de projet (identification, formulation, mise en oeuvre, suivi, évaluation); la maîtrise des méthodes de l'aide communautaire, notamment dans le cadre du FED, serait un plus.
  • Maîtrise du portugais (B1 ou B2)
  • La connaissance du français (B1 minimum) sera considérée comme un atout important

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to aurelie_durand@dai.com

*WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS *
